title: Man ‘trapped’ at top of 290ft Dixon’s Chimney sparking major rescue operation
text:
A man has become “trapped” at the top of Carlisle’s 290-ft Dixon’s Chimney sparking a major rescue operation.

Video footage shows a helicopter hovering near the top of the chimney where a figure appears to be dangling upside down as emergency crews attempt to rescue the man.

It is not known how the man came to be at the top of the structure or how long he has been stuck there, however local media reports suggest the alarm was raised at about 3am on Monday.

Roads in the area have been closed and neighbouring properties evacuated as emergency services attempt to free the man.

Local newspaper the News and Star said a couple living nearby heard "shouting and wailing" at 1am and then again at 3am, which is when they saw police had arrived.

Cumbria Police first reported it was dealing with the incident at about 5.30am.
